I just wanted to make a comment about the game itself... I watched several trailers of this game and it seemed a little interesting... I was sorta leery since it had a unique art to the graphical animation and thought that it would be just something different.. I also liked some of the features it was presenting with being able to play as different characters with special abilities and also being able to customize them some... I thought.. wow... what I cool change... different approach to a multiplayer game....

Then I played it day of release and was sadly disappointed.   Everyone I know that had great expectations were really let down like myself.   

So if you value your bandwidth and you had similar expectations of the game you may want to think before deciding to download this game and playing it.  It's not the worse game I ever played.. but it didn't exactly come anywhere close to what I was hoping to see in this game.   I apologize for giving such a negative review of the game... but I think there are alot of people that would agree with me on this one mates.   

Bottom line don't waste your time or money on this game if you are looking for something sweet like Call of Duty/Crysis type first person playing... because it doesn't hold a flame to the obvious best rate FPS games.

Just got the download done been knowing what to do for a while however have never received a CRC error in ABGX anyways this is what I get when I run it through ABGX...

Checking Game CRC... (press Q to cancel)
 Percent  Elapsed  Estimated   Time     Average     Current     Errors    Total
    Done     Time       Time   Left       Speed       Speed  Recovered  Retries
    100%     1:41       1:41   0:00   68.5 MB/s   72.6 MB/s

     AnyDVD style corruption was not detected
     Game CRC = 8F4D4EB6

Game partition CRC does not match the verified ini! There are 4 possibilities:

1. This is a bad rip (the most likely cause). If you're checking a DVD backup
and have AnyDVD or a similar app installed, make absolutely sure the process is
killed! If this is a scene release, search for it on abgx.net and look at the
column "Bad CRC or Needs Fixing". If you see a  icon, hover over it with
your mouse to read the alt text. If it says something like "Bad game data CRC"
or gives the name of a fix (PPF patch), we already know about it. It's also
highly recommended to run abgx360 again with AutoFix set to level 3 if you
applied a PPF to make sure stealth files haven't been corrupted. See "What is
AnyDVD style corruption?" in the GUI Quickstart tab for more info on game data
corruption.

2. Your CPU/RAM/HDD/data bus is unstable and corrupted the data during
extraction/burning or while checking the CRC. Make sure to run the sfv and try
extracting it again (assuming you have the sfv/rars) and recheck the ISO/DVD to
see if you get the same CRC.

3. Game data was intentionally modified for some reason. Microsoft does not
take kindly to modifications for any purpose, and even benign changes to game
data or settings will get you banned from Xbox Live!

4. The verified Game CRC in the database is wrong (very unlikely).

Stealth was verified but game data wasn't

Comparing L1 Video on L0 to L1 Video on L1... SplitVid is valid

Press any key to exit . . .
You don't EVER need the .DVD file, set the Layerbreak yourself!

Dude this has nothing to do with the .dvd file, this is about the game data not matching what is on the ISO. In other words most likely at some point during the game you would get cut off, hopefully it would be just like a scratched disk and offer no chance of being banned but I've seen it happen over stupider things.
